description: Borrowed from Italian pergola, from Latin pergula.

entries.meaning: A framework in the form of a passageway of columns that supports a trelliswork roof; used to support and train climbing plants.
examples: By the little garden pergola open to the winds some fluttered peacocks were blotted nervelessly amid the dripping trees, their heads sunk back beneath their wings: while in the pergola itself, like a fallen storm-cloud, lolled a negress, her levelled, polecat eyes semi-veiled by the nebulous alchemy of the rainbow.

entries.meaning: Such a framework employed to provide shade, especially over a patio.
